intro: Bauhinia castilloi, commonly known as the Mexican orchid tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, orchid-like flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Bauhinia castilloi thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in the Caesalpiniaceae family.
